title: Measuring relative reactivity of mouse TCRs against a mouse cancer cell line
title_html: Measuring relative reactivity of mouse TCRs against a mouse cancer cell line

protocol.title: Measuring relative reactivity of mouse TCRs against a mouse cancer cell line
protocol.title_html: Measuring relative reactivity of mouse TCRs against a mouse cancer cell line

source.description:
Order, clone, and midi-prep all the TCR and mouse CD8 plasmids:
and make sure they are of good quality for further applications.

Linearize plasmids using the corresponding enzymes right at the end of their inserts
Preferred enzyme for the OT-I plasmids is EcoRI:
and the preferred enzyme for the mouse CD8s is NotI:
We recommend the following restriction reaction:
of plasmid DNA
of the corresponding restriction enzyme
of the CutSmart Buffer (10X)
Top the reaction with nuclease-free water to
Incubate the reaction at
for at least
.

source.body: It is very important to fully linearize the plasmid to prevent potential off-running mRNAs. Based on the incubation time, the amount of enzyme can be reduced but the linearization should always be quality-checked via running the product on agarose gel when in doubt.

source.description:
Extract the linearized DNA via the standard phenol:chloroform extraction protocol:
Add
of nuclease-free water so that the final volume for the restriction reaction is
Add
of phenol:chloroform and vortex well
Spin at
Transfer the (top) aqueous layer to a new tube, add
chloroform, and vortex well
Spin at
Transfer the (top) aqueous layer to a new tube, add
absolute EtOH, and mix well by inverting the tube a few times
Keep the sample at
for at least
Spin at
Discard the supernatant without losing the pellet and add
70% EtOH to wash the pellet
Spin at
Discard the supernatant, remove all the residual alcohol, and resuspend the pellet in
nuclease-free water

In vitro transcribe mRNA using the linearized templates using NEB's
mRNA synthesis
and LiCl isolation protocols.
Store the IVT'ed mRNA at
for future use.

source.body: We recommend starting with of linearized template for each product and scaling the NEB's recommended reaction by 10X. Our preferred final elution volume is , which should yield 1.5 - 2 ug/uL mRNA.

source.title: Culturing and expanding effector and target cells (Day -3)

source.description:
Thaw the Jurkat-NFAT cells that come with the T cell bioactivity kit:
and culture them by seeding 5 million cells in
of Jurkat media within a T75 flask for at least 3 days or until they reach a density of 1.5 million cells per mL.

source.body:
Jurkat media:
  • of Corning™ RPMI 1640 Medium (Mod.) 1X with L-Glutamine
  • of Fetal Plus®
  • of Penicillin-Streptomycin (10,000 U/mL)

source.description: Electroporate Jurkats with mouse CD8 and OT-I subunits

source.title: Culturing and expanding effector and target cells (Day -3)

source.description: Thaw and start culturing MC38 cells. Seeding ~2 million cells in a T75 flask and culturing them for at least three days should yield enough cells for the co-culture.

source.body: We have been using MC38 cells as our effectors but the choice of cell line is up to the experimenter. Ideally, the cell line doesn't present the SIINFEKL peptide on its own (without pulsing) so that we can use it as a negative control when co-cultured with the OT-I TCR. This protocol assumes, the cell line is of adherent nature so any suspension cell line could require some customization.

source.description:
Fill 4 wells of a 6-well culture plate with
of warm Jurkat media. We will be using this plate as our recovery plate after the electroporation.

Spin them down at
    Re-suspend them in
    of PBS (first wash)
    Spin them down at
    Re-suspend them in
    of PBS (second wash)
    Re-suspend them in
    of R buffer

Add
of mouse CD8A mRNA (~
)
of mouse CD8B mRNA (~
)
of mouse OT-I alpha mRNA (~
)
of mouse OT-I beta mRNA (~
)
onto the
Jurkat cell suspension in R buffer and make sure you mix them well

Using Neon's the 100 uL tips, electroporate cells at 1350 V 10 ms 3 pulse setting. Use one tip for one reaction. Change the E2 solution every 6 electroporation reactions. Recover at most two reactions within each 6-well-plate well. Electroporate at least 8 reactions, which should yield 16 million Jurkat cells.

source.brand: Thermo Fisher Scientific Neon™ Transfection System

source.description: Let the electroporated Jurkat cells recover for at least 12 hours.
Seed MC38s into two solid-bottom white plates through 2-fold dilutions:

source.body: Although the final volume doesn't matter that much since we will be aspirating the media before setting the co-culture, when in doubt you can go with of media per well. To have 100K cells in of media, the serial dilution should start roughly at 3.3 million cells per mL concentration and we will be needing roughly 1.5 million cells per plate.

source.description: Let the targets cells attach and settle down for at least 12 hours.

Replenish Jurkats with fresh media:
  1. Collect and combine all electroporated cells into a single 50-mL falcon tube
  2. Spin
  5. Discard the supernatant
  6. Re-suspend in
  8. of fresh Jurkat media (~ 1.3 million cells per mL)
  9. Split the cell suspension into two (5 mL each) 15-mL falcon tubes
Spin
  1. Discard the supernatant
  2. Re-suspend in
  4. of fresh Jurkat media (~ 1.3 million cells per mL)
  5. Split the cell suspension into two (5 mL each) 15-mL falcon tubes
Re-suspend in
of fresh Jurkat media (~ 1.3 million cells per mL)
    Label and pulse one of the tubes with the SIINFEKL peptide at
    (9.63 ug/mL)
Aspirate the media from the MC38-seeded plates

Add
(~100K) of the electroporated Jurkats onto each well. Label the plates as pulsed or unpulsed accordingly.
This should give us the following plate setup:

source.body: To reduce the chances of cross-contamination, always start by setting up the co-culture for the unpulsed condition.

source.name: SpectraMax i3 Multi-Mode Microplate Detection Platform
OT-I TCR reactivity against SIINFEKL-pulsed or -unpulsed MC38s

materials.name: HiScribe T7 ARCA mRNA Kit (with Tailing) - 20 rxns
SpectraMax i3 Multi-Mode Microplate Detection Platform
CELL CULTURE MICROPLATE 96 WELL PS F-BOTTOM (CHIMNEY WELL) WHITE CELLSTAR® TC LID WITH CONDENS

description: This protocol repurposes Promega's T Cell Activiation Bioassay workflow to be able to test relative mouse TCR reactivity against a cell line. This specific protocol uses MC38 as the target as it doesn't normally present SIINFEKL and have good H2Kb and H2Db expression levels. The reactivity will be in relative to the positive control (OT-I reactivity against SIINFEKL-pulsed cells) and the negative control (OT-I reactiviy against unpulsed cells).
